thread.title: Norwegian Jade Cruise Ship Emerges From Dry Dock With New Bars, Restaurants and Refurbished Cabins
thread.title_full: Norwegian Jade Cruise Ship Emerges From Dry Dock With New Bars, Restaurants and Refurbished Cabins

title: Norwegian Jade Cruise Ship Emerges From Dry Dock With New Bars, Restaurants and Refurbished Cabins
text:
Norwegian Jade Cruise Ship Emerges From Dry Dock With New Bars, Restaurants and Refurbished Cabins Norwegian Jade Cruise Ship Emerges From Dry Dock With New Bars, Restaurants and Refurbished Cabins Subscribe March 30, 2017 
(6:30 p.m. EST) -- A handful of new eateries and bars, revamped cabins and expanded restaurant space are just a few of the improvements Norwegian Jade received during its three-week March dry dock. 
The ship now offers 24-hour free pub grub at O'Sheehan's and complimentary poolside fare (think burgers and fries) at Pit Stop, a 1950s-style diner where classic car accents and vintage license plates serve as decor. 
Both restaurants are new to the ship, which has undergone renovations as part of Norwegian Cruise Line's Norwegian Edge program, which aims to make the cruise experience more uniform across all ships, regardless of size or age. 
Additionally, Moderno Churrascaria was relocated and now offers sea views; more seating was added to Cagney's Steakhouse , which now boasts a virtual fireplace; La Cucina, the ship's Italian restaurant, was spruced up and now features a wine wall; and Japanese hibachi venue Teppanyaki received a facelift, along with Jasmine Garden and Garden Cafe. 
Other changes to public spaces include upgrades to the pool areas, the Sugarcane mojito bar and the Spinnaker Lounge; new TechnoGym equipment in the fitness center; and the addition of Bliss Ultra Lounge, a nightclub with a Miami vibe. In the atrium, a new custom-designed chandelier hangs overhead. 
All cabins onboard were outfitted with new carpet, furniture, flat-screen TVs and headboards with bedside USB charging outlets. Villas, suites and cabins in The Haven , Norwegian's "ship within a ship" concept, have new finishes on walls and ceilings, as well as new draperies and flooring. The Haven also features four new cabanas. In all, the ship's staterooms display more than 2,250 pieces of upgraded artwork. 
"We're thrilled to welcome Norwegian Jade back into the fleet with her new stylish finishes and modernized onboard atmosphere," said Andy Stuart, Norwegian Cruise Line president and CEO, in a statement. 
For the next month, Norwegian Jade will offer its regular winter season itineraries to the Western Caribbean from Tampa. On April 30, the ship will relocate to Europe via a transatlantic voyage, spending its summer sailing to Norway from Southampton and Hamburg. 
--By Ashley Kosciolek, Editor Get expert advice, insider tips and more. Sign Up Today © 1995—2017, The Independent Traveler, Inc. × Become a cruise insider

These are moderated message boards. What this means is that we do our best to remove all objectionable messages from the boards. It also means that you cannot say whatever you'd like on the forums. If you are looking for an "anything goes" setting, Cruise Critic might not be the place for you. Understand, too, that our community is comprised of folks who LOVE to cruise. It therefore stands to reason that they will have a favorite cruise line or port of call -- in other words, they are "fans" and will sometimes take offense when a brand new member has arrived on the scene to bash a cruise line.
